data.title: Using Sydneys tunnels
data.meta_description: The Roads network has a series of significant tunnels that provide effective, fast and safe routes for customers travelling around the city.
data.text:
Image

Customers travelling through tunnels can make that experience a more efficient and safer activity by considering the following tips:

Be aware of the tunnel heights for vehicles (see below)

Check LiveTraffic.com to see if there are any closures for maintenance works

Always leave your radio turned on when driving through

Take your sunglasses off (unless optical prescription glasses)

Always check electronic message boards where available

Avoid changing lanes

Keep a safe distance from the vehicle in front

Turn your headlights on.

Wind up your windows and set air conditioning to recirculate.

Tunnel heights to know

Airport - 4.4 metres

City West link (east bound only) - 4.6 metres

Cross City Tunnel - 4.4 metres

Domain - 4.4 metres

Eastern Distributor - 4.4 metres

Kings Cross - 4.4 metres

Lane Cove - 4.4 metres

Hills M2 Motorway - 5.0 metres

M5 East Cooks River - 4.4 metres

M5 East Main - 4.6 metres

M8 - 5.1 metres

M4 - M8 Link - 5.1 metres

M4 Tunnels - 5.1 metres

Sydney Harbour Tunnel - 4.4 metres

NorthConnex - 5.1 metres.

Image

Is my vehicle over size?

Learn more about over size and heavy vehicles.
